definitions.definition: A small fold or ridge of tissue that supports or restrains the motion of the part to which it is attached, in particular a fold of skin beneath the tongue , or between the lip and the gum .
examples: Humans have three oral frenulums : beneath the tongue, between the upper lip and gum, and between the lower lip and gum.

definitions.definition: A bristle or row of bristles on the edge of the hindwings of some lepidoptera which unites the wings by interlocking with a catch on the posterior part of the forewings .

main_definition: ( anatomy ) A small fold or ridge of tissue that supports or restrains the motion of the part to which it is attached, in particular a fold of skin beneath the tongue , or between the lip and the gum .
secondary_definitions: ( entomology , zootomy ) A bristle or row of bristles on the edge of the hindwings of some lepidoptera which unites the wings by interlocking with a catch on the posterior part of the forewings .
